comments.body:
```suggestion
Choice observers get to see a all exercises of a specific choice on a contract, and to view its consequences.
```

Right now the ledger model doesn't include a notion of a choice. I do want to add it when I find a bit of spare time, but until then I would maybe not mention them here (to avoid confusion, I'm refering to Moritz's suggestion here)
A short blurb choice observers should also be added to the "DAML: Defining Contract Models Compactly" section
@cocreature  I think a choice observer can depend on the arguments to the choice, right? So they really are observers to a specific exercise, not to every exercise on the choice.

good point, I guess it might still be useful to state somewhere that they are defined by choice but that brings up to @oggy-’s point that choices aren’t included in here at all so keeping it at exercises should be perfectly fine.
Maybe we should have called them "exercise observer"... In any case I think @sofiafaro-da 's phrasing was good.

In addition to contract observers, the contract model can also specify **choice observers** on individual **Exercise** actions.

on an action, for the purposes of projection (see below).
